name: In the Matter of the EMPLOYEES OF BROWNSVILLE GENERAL HOSPITAL. Appeal of PENNSYLVANIA LABOR RELATIONS BOARD
name_abbreviation: In re the Employees of Brownsville General Hospital

judges: Before JONES, C. J. and EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
parties: In the Matter of the EMPLOYEES OF BROWNSVILLE GENERAL HOSPITAL. Appeal of PENNSYLVANIA LABOR RELATIONS BOARD.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
The issue in this appeal is now moot. The appeal is dismissed.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: James F. Wildeman, Raymond W. Cromer, James L. Crawford, Harrisburg, for appellant.
Ira B. Coldren, Jr., Coldren & Coldren, Uniontown, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
346 A.2d 260
In the Matter of the EMPLOYEES OF BROWNSVILLE GENERAL HOSPITAL. Appeal of PENNSYLVANIA LABOR RELATIONS BOARD.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Sept. 22, 1975.
Decided Oct. 30, 1975.
James F. Wildeman, Raymond W. Cromer, James L. Crawford, Harrisburg, for appellant.
Ira B. Coldren, Jr., Coldren & Coldren, Uniontown, for appellee.
Before JONES, C. J. and EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
